channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: I’m a senior who barely survives on $1,300 a month. No way could I live on $1,000.
item.description: “We seniors are pressured and scammed into buying a lot of things we don’t need.”

item.title: A recent college grad asks: How do I compete with AI to get a job in finance?
item.description: For finance majors specifically, many of the tasks associated with entry-level jobs are being automated. But if you start seeing AI as a tool instead ...

item.title: Stock market rally on hot CPI print is indicative of market strength, declares strategist Tom Lee
item.description: Tom Lee says it’s a sign of how robust the stock market is right now that gains came on a hotter-than-forecast core CPI report.

item.title: The biggest winners of the Taylor Swift-Travis Kelce podcast
item.description: After years of speculation, Taylor Swift will finally appear on Travis and Jason Kelce’s podcast “New Heights,” in an episode that is scheduled to be ...

item.title: ‘I’m tired of corporate America’: My wife and I have $1.65 million. I’m 61. Can I retire already?
Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat
item.description: Arabica coffee prices hit a record level, as traders digested the withdrawal of President Trump’s threats to impose tariffs and economic sanctions on ...

item.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
item.description: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia...

item.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.
